This was working a couple months ago, but in recent builds it's not. If required, I can probably remove all my internal content from my plug-in so you have an example to work from.

I've written a plug-in that contributes to the UI and integrates with the help system by doing the following:

        PlatformUI.getWorkbench().getHelpSystem()
            .setHelp(parent, "myHelpID");

I'm getting the following NPE:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.help.search.LuceneSearchParticipant.resolveVariables(LuceneSearchParticipant.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.CheatsheetSearchParticipant.getAllDocuments(CheatsheetSearchParticipant.java:53)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.search.IndexingOperation.getAddedDocuments(IndexingOperation.java:401)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.search.IndexingOperation.execute(IndexingOperation.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.search.SearchManager.updateIndex(SearchManager.java:871)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.search.SearchManager.ensureIndexUpdated(SearchManager.java:835)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.search.SearchManager.search(SearchManager.java:602)
	at org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.views.DynamicHelpPart.performSearch(DynamicHelpPart.java:265)
	at org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.views.DynamicHelpPart.access$5(DynamicHelpPart.java:259)
	at org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.views.DynamicHelpPart$3.run(DynamicHelpPart.java:248)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Actually the exception you're getting seems unrelated to what you're doing. See bug 148056 for this one. As for the context help not working, you need to specify the full ID including the plugin here - so something like com.my.plugin.myHelpId.

Can you confirm this was the problem?

This might be the same issue as 148056. My project has not moved from 3.2 to 3.2.1 yet, so I can't verify it's fixed for a few weeks yet. The id I used in my example was just a place holder. In my real plug-in the id is fully qualified as you describe. I changed it here after I pasted in the code to avoid getting my hand slapped by the legal team.

I guess since this has been fixed in 3.2.1 that this defect can be closed. Once we make the move to that stream if it's not fixed I can always reopen this defect.

Just to clarify, the problem you're describing, or at least implying (context help doesn't work) is unrelated to the stack trace. You should still get that stack trace even if you don't use context help at all. Fixing bug 148056 won't do anything to context help, it just fixes the unrelated stack trace.

Is it really the case that you cannot get context help to show up for your UI or were you just assuming that since you saw a stack trace it wouldn't work? I think I may be missing something here.

Here's what happens:

1) The user opens my UI and presses F1 to open the help.
2) A dialog opens with a bunch of error messages in the help indexer and the dynamic help search. (I will attach a file with the dialog so you can see it)
3) The help content is displayed.

The issue isn't that the help is not displayed. It's that everytime the user goes to the help they will see this error dialog that says there were errors related to the help.

If the other bug you mentioned has been fixed in 3.2.1, this dialog will probably not come up and everything will be fine.

Created an attachment (id=46383)
Screen cap of error dialog

Now I understand. You're right, with the fix to the other bug it will suppress the error message and just send the stack trace to the log instead, so you won't see it. However that's not the end of it.. the bug was to handle errors more gracefully, meaning that there's still a problem in one of your product's cheat sheets. It's in the extension where you specify the path to the XML file for the cheat sheet. I recall debugging one earlier where it was using windows slashes and on Linux it would cause the same problem as you're seeing (which is why that bug is open). I was working with Susan Yeshin on this one so if you're on the same product/team you can ask her if it's the same one she was seeing. If not, then you can open a bug on your product.

I'm closing this one since we've done all we can on the issue in 3.2.1 (and we can't change 3.2).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 148056 ***
